{"step_by_step_thinking": "In class III composite preparation, retention points should be placed at the dentinoenamel junction. This is because the dentinoenamel junction provides a strong and stable foundation for the composite restoration. Placing retention points in the axial wall or entirely in dentine may weaken the tooth structure and increase the risk of fracture. Placing retention points at the expense of facial and lingual walls is not recommended as it can compromise the esthetics of the restoration.", "answer_choice": "C"}
